intro: Syngramma vittiformis, commonly known as the broad-banded flatid, is a species of planthopper in the family Flatidae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, Asia, and Australia, where it inhabits a variety of forest and woodland environments. The plant has a distinctive appearance, with a flattened body and intricate patterns that mimic leaves, providing excellent camouflage. Its botanical features include elongated, segmented body parts and specialized mouthparts adapted for piercing and sucking plant tissues. Syngramma vittiformis plays a role in its ecosystem as both a herbivore and a prey species for various predators.
